result.execSummary:
The defendant Stewart L Herrera was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Financial obligations to be paid directly to the Clerk of Courts by 9/12/22, or payment arrangements to be made with Clerk's Office.
Maintain absolute sobriety, Not to possess or consume intoxicants, No taverns or to be in the tavern portion of any restaurant premises. Not to possess, use, or ingest illegal drugs
Any other counseling or treatment as deemed appropriate by agents.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stewart L Herrera

defendant.name: Herrera, Stewart L
defendant.address: 410 Northern Ave Upper, Green Bay, WI 54303

records.descr: Notice of intent to pursue post-conviction relief

records.addlTxt: 9:19 AM Defendant Stewart L Herrera in court, in custody.  Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek appeared by video for Stewart L Herrera.  ADA Dennis Brown appears in court for State of Wisconsin. State relays plea agreement.  Defense rejects probation.  Plea questionnaire filed.  Rights given.  Court finds that defendant is knowingly and voluntarily waiving right to jury trial and plea is found to be entered knowingly and voluntarily.  Found guilty. State's exhibit #1: Certified driving record; received by court. State and Defense make statements.  Defendant does not make statement. Court imposes 4 years in the Wisconsin State Prison System: 18 months initial confinement, 2.5 months extended supervision.  Conditions of probation: Maintain absolute sobriety, Not to possess or consume intoxicants, No taverns or to be in the tavern portion of any restaurant premises. Not to possess, use, or ingest illegal drugs, Any other Counseling or treatment as deemed appropriate, Take medications only as prescribed, Permanent driver's license revocation, 24 month IID, Fine and costs in the sum of $1,284.  Court finds defendant substance abuse programming eligible after 14 months and CIP eligible.  Felony advisements given. Court directs Attorney to go through the Notice of Right to Postconviction Relief with the defendant.  Court indicates that attorney is to remain on the case for the next 20 days should the defendant have any questions.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.

11:53 AM Defendant Stewart L Herrera in court, in custody.  Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek in court for Stewart L Herrera.  ADA Dennis Brown in court for State of Wisconsin. 
 Pleas and sentencing will not be held today without the BAC blood draw results on record and certified driving record filed with court. Court denies motion to modify bond.  Bond Cont.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:25 AM Defendant Stewart L Herrera in court, in custody.  Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek in court for Stewart L Herrera. ADA Brown  in court for State of Wisconsin.  Defense is stating defendant is rejecting probation. Court has no BAC on record. Defense moves for signature bond.  Court denies signature bond. Case will be adjourned later today with expectation records will be on file. Court adjourned at 11:40 AM
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 11:45 am.
Judicial Pretrial - in court on June 21, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Defendant Stewart L Herrera appeared by zoom video from the Vilas County Jail.  Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek appeared by zoom video for Stewart L Herrera.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin.  Criminal Complaint received.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing.  Court read charges, rights given.  Court finds that waiver is done so voluntarily.  Probable cause found.  Bound over for arraignment on information.  Not guilty plea entered.  Bond continued.  Judicial Pretrial set for June 21, 2022 at 9:15 a.m.

1:43 PM Defendant Stewart L Herrera in court, in custody, without counsel.  ADA Dennis Brown appears in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant confirms receipt of criminal complaint.  Court reads charges.  Defendant provided public defender information.  $4,000 Cash bond set with conditions: Maintain absolute sobriety, Not to possess or consume intoxicants, No taverns or to be in the tavern portion of any restaurant premises. Bond form.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
